channel.description: Recent content in Home on Bryan Li's Webpage

item.title: About
item.description: I am an undergraduate at UC Berkeley doing a double degree in mathematics and computer science. I am generally interested in geometry, analysis, PDEs, and mathematical physics, and especially in the intersections. However, I am also interested in other areas of math and computer science. I can be contacted at byli [] berkeley [] edu, where the blanks are filled in with the obvious placeholders.

item.title: Expository
item.description: This page is a WIP. Here are some expository things that I have written. These are likely neither correct nor complete, but if you find any mistakes feel free to let me know. Notes from the Texas A&M 2025 Summer School in Mathematical Physics: Will be uploaded shortly Quantum Chaos and RMT: Quantum Dynamics: Grushin Problems: Slides from contributed talk (by me!): Band Crossings in Twisted Multilayer Graphene Notes from classes:
